701371f-c.title: Bronx: Johnson Avenue - Kappock Street
701371f-c.text:

Johnson Avenue, north from near Eappock Street, showing the
thoroughfare being repaved by the Works Progress Administration.
March 10, 19S7

701368f-a.title: Bronx: Johnson Avenue - Kappock Street
701368f-a.text:
Johnson Avenue, at Kappock Street, looking northward.
Johnson Avenue continces northward around the right side of
the house seen in the center of the view; Kappock Street
commences at the fence (left), this side of the school build-
ing and skirts the house to the left. The school is Public
School No. 24. This area is on Spuyten Duyvil Hill...
October 7, 1927
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
NNey Ni 7a
(2)
The same, years 1ater.
July 15, 1939
P. L. Sperr
NO RPRODUCTIONS
Ao N Es

701370f.title: Bronx: Johnson Avenue - Kappock Street
701370f.text:
Johnson Ave., west from but not including Nappock Street. The
lower part of the Henry Nudson Bridge is visible in the background.
November 12, 1936.
Works Progress Administration.
Federal Art Project photo.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.

701372f-a.title: Bronx: Johnson Avenue - Kappock Street
701372f-a.text:
Johnson Ave. (foreground, not seen), east side, between its junction
with Kappock Street and its junction with Irwin Ave., showing a duck
pond.
October 27, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
